decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: Design and Access Statement, Energy Statement, Fire Statement, Biodiversity Statement, Transport Statement, Site Location Plan, 105/21, 105/22, 105/23, 105/24A, 105/25A, 105/04, 105/05G, 105/31G, 105/32G, 105/35G, 105/36G � received 12th August 2024,
105/30H � received 2nd October 2024

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 5 - Secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 4 bicycles) for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development shall be installed in the site. The approved facilities shall conform to the current Westtrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance (or such other guidance as shall supersede it) in design and layout and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction. 
Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 6 - The approved refuse and recycling store as shown on approved plan no. 105/30H shall be completed and made available for use before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, and thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction. Bins shall be stored within the store at all times and shall not be left on the public highway.
Reason: In order to ensure adequate provision for waste and recycling.

Condition : 7 - The building(s) hereby permitted shall not be occupied or brought into use until the means of vehicular access has been constructed in accordance with the approved plans.
Reason: In order to protect the appearance of the and in the interests of highway safety.

Condition : 8 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the existing vehicular access to the site shall be permanently closed and [kerbs/verge/footway] reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.
Reason: In order to enhance the pedestrian environment and to confine vehicular access to the permitted points in order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or highway safety along the adjacent highway.

description: Erection a single storey rear extension and conversion into two self contained units
